abstract: Markets fell sharply on renewed concerns about the sovereign debt problems in Europe.
snippet: Markets fell sharply on renewed concerns about the sovereign debt problems in Europe.
lead_paragraph: Europe’s nervous markets were calmed, at last, on Monday after the European Union and the International Monetary Fund broke their logjam and approved a long-delayed financial rescue package for Greece. But then Tuesday came, and that poise vanished.

headline.main: After Day of Calm, Anxiety Returns to Europe’s Markets
headline.print_headline: After Day of Calm, Anxiety Returns to Europe’s Markets

byline.original: By Graham Bowley and Christine Hauser
